intro: Palicourea shuar, commonly known as Shuar's palicourea, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. Due to its habitat in the dense rainforest, it is rarely found outside its native range.
